bio:treatment.description: Plants dwarfed, green to dark green, <carpet-forming, 5–20 cm, rarely taller>. Stems appressed- to ascending-hairy. Leaves: stipules translucent, quickly turning brownish; blade ± orbiculate, palmately compound, leaflets 5–7, narrowly elliptic to oblanceolate, apices with 7–11 teeth, margins flat, abaxial surface sericeous, adaxial shiny, glabrous. Inflorescences: primary branches densely appressed-hairy. Pedicels <usually shorter than hypanthia>, densely appressed-hairy. Flowers: epicalyx bractlet lengths 0.5 or less times sepals; hypanthium densely pubescent; <sepals erect after flowering>. Achenes not exserted.
meadows herb slopes moist rock ledges
bio:treatment.discussion: In the flora area, Alchemilla alpina is possibly introduced except in Greenland.
